result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael J. Heitke

records.addlTxt: appointing Atty Richard Davis w/payment schedule
appointing Atty Richard Davis w/payment schedule
for a return date 12/6/22 at 9:00 A.M.

9:58 AM Defendant Michael J. Heitke in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jonathan Ross in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court appoints Atty Richard Davis at the rate of $100 per hour, defendant to reimburse Columbia County at the rate of $100.00 per month, commencing on the 1st of each month, along w/other payment plan, matter to be reset,
Return date scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:34 AM Defendant Michael J. Heitke appeared by phone.  Attorney Jonathan Ross in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant was unable to appear today, Court authorized a warrant with a stay until 10/25/ 2022 at 10:00 AM
Return date scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Pre- trial 9/30/22 at 11:20 AM
Return date 10/18/22 at 10:00 AM
Standard felony conditions, Not leave the State of WI without written permission of the court, Not operate motor vehicle without a valid license.

1:46 PM Defendant Michael J. Heitke appeared by video, in custody from Columbia County jail.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim appeared by video for Michael J. Heitke.  Prosecuting attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for the State of Wisconsin. waived reading of complaint, right to attorney recited, $500.00 cash bond, standard felony conditions, Not operate motor vehicle without a valid license. waived time limit for preliminary hearing 1:53 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 11:20 am.
